title: Stack Data Structure
subject: Data Structures
theory:
A Stack follows **LIFO** (Last In, First Out). Think of a stack of plates; you add to the top and remove from the top. 
Operations: Push (Add), Pop (Remove), Peek (View top), isEmpty.

examples.explanation: Last element added (2) is first removed.

common_mistakes.correction: Popping from an empty stack causes crash. Always check !isEmpty().

interview_questions.question: Implement Stack using Queues?
interview_questions.answer: Possible but expensive. Push becomes O(n) or Pop O(n).

summary: Stacks manage function calls and undo operations.
